intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. parviflora, commonly known as the lesser eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent dark markings, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, often with a bluish-green hue. Euphrasia officinalis var. parviflora is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies for eye and respiratory conditions.
